text: There are dozens of them dating back years.

Nope, I mean that if I have a module embedded and that module does not provide any editable fields to the page/blog editor, it would be great to be able to prevent it from showing up at all. There are a number of modules that we have setup where we explicitly do not want page editors to make changes, so we restrict the abililty to edit the fields... but the problem is that when a module with NO editable fields is included in a page, it still appears in the sidebar.
Ya sounds like your Christmas list is a difficult one arlo
Do you think it would be a valuable tool to build?

It's not that hard to build, a single custom module named "Approvals" that is accessible to blogs/emails/pages/landingpages with a single boolean field named "Request Publication Approval" - then you can either use the internal HubSpot service ticketing system or an external approval tool like Zapier.

For the HubSpot team to build this internally would be better as the approach above is a little cludgy.
